Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are electrochemical devices that convert the chemical energy of fuels directly into electricity with high conversion efficiency.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A major advantage of SOFC systems compared to low-temperature fuel cells is that SOFCs can use humidified hydrocarbons as fuel.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the use of hydrocarbons may lead to an undesirable carbon deposition as hydrocarbons are oxidized at the anode side in SOFCs.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Such carbon deposits on the nickel-yttrium stabilized zirconia (Ni-YSZ) anode material are the most probable mode of deactivation of SOFCs.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, commercially available NiO-YSZ anode material for high-temperature fuel cells was activated by a temperature-programmed reduction in a hydrogen atmosphere.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the next step, carbon was deliberately deposited on the reduced samples by isothermal deposition in a methane-argon atmosphere.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The carbon deposits were then burned off with a temperature-programmed oxidation (TPO) in an oxygen-argon atmosphere at different heating rates using thermo-analytical equipment.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The TPO was followed by TG, DTG, DTA and QMS measurements.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The easiest way to distinguish among various types of deposited carbon was to follow the QMS curves.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The obtained QMS curves were processed with Netzsch Peak Separation software in order to extract several peaks corresponding to various forms of carbon deposits.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It was found that high amorphous and low amorphous carbon are burned off at relatively low temperatures (up to 650 A degrees C), fibrous carbon is oxidized up to 750 A degrees C, graphite is burned out up to 830 A degrees C and finally, carbon diluted in nickel leaves the system in the 900-1000 A degrees C range, depending on the oxidizing conditions.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The isoconversional method was used to calculate activation energies of various carbon oxidation processes.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The absolute values of the activation energies increase from amorphous carbon via fibrous carbon to graphite.
Titulo: Oxidation of carbon deposits on anode material Ni-YSZ in solid oxide fuel cells
